review_data: Reviewed in the United States üá∫üá∏ on January 13, 2021
name: Sarah H.
title: Design Flaws - Better Brands Out There
review: We LOVED this, and was a cool sensory toy too, but it had a few design flaws:( My kids really enjoyed it and it felt therapeutic actually to use it, even for me!However,1) There is no good way to secure the magnet pen so it doesn't easily get lost. It doesn't easily stay in place/go into place for my 3 and 5 year old.2) The tip of the magnet pen rubbed off and was no longer magnetic after about 2 days - we were very disappointed.3) The balls also started "sticking" and didn't fall back down into the holes.It is SUCH a cool idea and I actually found a different brand that I REALLY love that doesn't have those issues and feels like a really great quality product.Overall, I think this particular toy had great potential and maybe we got a fluke or something, but even if that was the case, I still think the design could use some work as far as the pen attachment goes. I would not personally purchase this item again or recommend it:(

name: Paul (Rochester, NY)
title: Fun for all kids!
review: My girls, ages 7 and 10, really like playing with this. They have had fun creating their own pictures, and copying the enclosed ideas as well. I am a pediatric occupational therapist and plan to use this with my kids in my sessions. It will be very motivating to them to work on shapes and letters, as well as fine motor and visual motor skills. I'm really satisfied with this purchase!
